wiki.summary: Elton John turned social isolation into music by inviting several artists to collaborate on the album The Lockdown Sessions, including Dua Lipa, with whom he sings on “Cold Heart.” In an interview with The Late Show With Stephen Colbert, the singer recalled the star's invitation - which came during an unusual situation. Elton John turned social isolation into music by inviting several artists to collaborate on the album The Lockdown Sessions, including Dua Lipa, with whom he sings on “Cold Heart. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: Elton John turned social isolation into music by inviting several artists to collaborate on the album The Lockdown Sessions, including Dua Lipa, with whom he sings on “Cold Heart.” In an interview with The Late Show With Stephen Colbert, the singer recalled the star's invitation - which came during an unusual situation. Elton John turned social isolation into music by inviting several artists to collaborate on the album The Lockdown Sessions, including Dua Lipa, with whom he sings on “Cold Heart.” In an interview with The Late Show With Stephen Colbert, the singer recalled the star's invitation - which came during an unusual situation. “It was Elton's idea and every time I talk about it I think it was the craziest thing in the world because I still can't believe we have a song,” he revealed. “It was funny, actually. Elton and I did some stuff together, I performed for his NGO at the Oscars opening and after that, we went out to dinner.” Read more on Last.fm.
